content.description: A great addition to breakneck! Pumpy and juggy with a fun crux.
content.protection: The bottom two bolts each protect the bottom cruxes nicely.  There is a bit of a run out to bolt #3, but the climbing is 3 grades easier than it is at the crux.
content.location: This is the right most route of the three routes on the back side of the lower slabs.

content.protection: 4 bolts to shared anchor with The Right Spice.  New bolt schema as of 8/28/21.  Second bolt lowered and another bolt added to better prevent a ground fall.
content.location: Middle of three routes on the back side.

content.description: Most likely the best of the 3 climbs on this face.  If you use the large flake behind the tree the grade is a little easier.
content.location: Left of the 3 bolted climbs.  Just right of the tree.

content.description: This is the most climber friendly and easiest lead at Breakneck.  It is reasonable for the grade with secure holds and stances.  Much less committing than Eclipse and easier than the three climbs on the front side of The Cannabis Boulder.  There are a good variety of moves and body positions as you work your way through the different sections of this short but very fun route. A great addition to this area.
content.location: This is the left most route of the three routes on the back (lower) side of The Cannabis Boulder.

content.description:
A route similar to Cannabis. This one is the right of the three routes on this block.

 5.5 seems a fair rating, as this route is easier than Eclipse (5.6). While neither of these lower routes are particularly exciting climbs, the view from the anchors is the best at Breakneck. And they're the only ones that get consistent sun!

Appears to be run out at first glance but well protected. 

  While this route, like its next-door neighbor (Touch of Green, 5.6), is not especially interesting to climb, the view from the anchors is the best at Breakneck. (And they're the only ones that get consistent sun!) Oh, and the evenly dispersed array of small pockets make Cannabis, like Eclipse (5.6), a less height-dependent route than most of the problems on the Main & Right walls and thus a similarly good choice for a first lead attempt by novice sport climbers (especially on a busy day when the upper area is mobbed).
content.protection: 3 bolts, ring shuts at the top.

content.description: This is the short free standing block that is a bit down hill from the main area (and to the left when walking away from The Main Wall).  The routes here are only 40' high.  Beware that the three old routes on the front side have hard starts for the grade.  Perhaps consider stick clipping if you are a new leader and these grades are at your lead limit.  There are also three new routes on the back (lower) side that were established in 2018.
